verses.roman:
tatrāhur brāhmaṇāḥ kecid
āsīnā brahma-vādinaḥ
pūrveṣāṁ puṇya-yaśasāṁ
rājñāṁ cākathayan kathāḥ

synonyms: tatra—there; āhuḥ—spoke; brāhmaṇāḥ—brāhmaṇas; kecit—some; āsīnāḥ—seated; brahma—in the Vedas; vādinaḥ—fluent; pūrveṣām—of those of the past; puṇya—pious; yaśasām—whose fame; rājñām—of kings; ca—and; ākathayan—they recounted; kathāḥ—stories.
translation: Some brāhmaṇas sitting in that assembly hall would fluently chant Vedic mantras, while others recounted stories of past kings of pious renown.
